diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Life-threatening anemia secondary to blood loss from scratching due to pruritus associated with bulky perineal nevocytoma variant of giant congenital melanocytic nevus.
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Iron deficiency anemia, atopic dermatitis, mastocytoma, human papillomavirus infection, coagulopathy.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The anemia was attributed to blood loss from external wounds in the nevus secondary to continuous scratching, confirmed by laboratory findings of iron deficiency anemia, and ruled out other potential causes through clinical evaluation and procedures such as colonoscopy and coagulopathy workup.
